Award.AwardTitle: RAPID: Facilitating Rapid and Actionable Responses to Social, Behavioral, and Economic-Related COVID Questions: The Societal Experts Action Network (SEAN)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Social, Behav & Economic Scie

Award.AbstractNarration: The COVID-19 pandemic has disrupted nearly every aspect of life across the globe. As decision-makers at the federal, state, and local level respond, they are grappling with numerous complex scientific questions. Many of these questions are grounded in the social, behavioral, and economic (SBE) sciences. Questions such as: <br/><br/> • What strategies are most likely to restart economic growth in critically important sectors that were heavily affected by COVID-19?<br/> • How can governments more effectively encourage use of masks and other strategies to reduce disease transmission?<br/> • What recent knowledge will allow public and private sector educational entities to improve on-line learning outcomes? <br/><br/>The Division of Behavioral and Social Sciences and Education (DBASSE) at the National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine (NASEM), in collaboration with the National Science Foundation, establishes the Societal Experts Action Network (SEAN). SEAN produce products designed to provide actionable responses to urgent policy questions asked by federal, state, and local decision-makers. SEAN is unique in its focus on rapid, readable, and research-based insights in response to questions on issues such as the reopening of businesses and economic growth, the education of children, the mental health and resilience of our communities, and many more. The resulting products are made publicly available and widely disseminated, which benefits not only the requesting official, but a broad range of decision-makers and the public. The value of SBE sciences in addressing problems of national importance is shared with an expansive audience, thus contributing to our nation’s overarching understanding of how best to deploy SBE knowledge in pandemic and other crisis situations.<br/><br/>This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The National Academies of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine established the Societal Experts Action Network (SEAN) in May 2020 with the support of the National Science Foundation (NSF) to connect social, behavioral, and economic (SBE) scientists with decision makers at all levels of government. This network was established in response to the COVID-19 pandemic to answer complex and timely questions, and to provide state and local decision makers with actionable guidance based on evidence from the SBE sciences. SEAN has developed a governance structure and established relationships with key decision maker groups which has allowed the team to identify high priority questions related to the COVID-19 pandemic and prioritize topics with a strong SBE evidence base to produce actionable guidance for state and local decision makers.

SEAN has successfully produced a variety of products to meet the needs of state and local decision makers, including rapid expert consultation (REC) documents, interactive webpages, and webinars. To date, SEAN has produced nine RECs on COVID-related topics that range from evaluating different data types to encouraging protective behaviors such as mask wearing and improving evacuation and sheltering during disasters. These RECs, which are short documents written for a policy audience, have been downloaded more than 22,000 times in all 50 states and in over 130 countries by readers in the federal, state, and local government, nonprofit organizations, and academia, among other sectors. Each REC has a corresponding interactive webpage which is designed to highlight key takeaways from the REC in a digestible and engaging format. The webinars have been used both as information gathering sessions to inform RECs as well as dissemination and promotion methods for existing RECs. SEAN has conducted nine webinars, attracting more than 5,400 participants and yielding over 2,000 questions. Feedback received from REC downloads and webinar participants indicate that SEAN products are reaching their intended audiences and providing practical guidance for decision makers. In addition, SEAN has heard from decision makers in state and local government that the SEAN products are valuable both in informing their understanding of issues related to COVID-19 and conveying pertinent information to their constituents.

An independent evaluation team at American University, funded separately by NSF, evaluated SEAN over its first year. The evaluators conducted interviews with SEAN clients, stakeholders, and staff; reviewed SEAN documents; and conducted a survey of SEAN webinar participants. The evaluation team found that SEAN is able to produce rapid response, high quality products that are valuable to users.
